{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3434580,"name":"Jim Jackson","username":"JJTJ2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-14T15:36:15.439Z","cooked":"

Hello,

Over this past season, we have had some issues with Pathplanner. When running red paths, each auto is not repeatable. For example for the easy 3, sometimes it will go further than it was supposed to, or come up short, or rotate too much or too little. Sometimes it will go to the left, sometimes to the right. other times right down the middle. And any combination of the above. On blue, these paths are consistent and run perfectly. We are wondering if any other team has had this issue and if they have found a solution.

We have a competition in a few days but have been dealing with this all season.

Here is our C++ code: CODE

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-10-14T15:36:15.439Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":78,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":444.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":472997,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-inconsistencies","display_username":"Jim Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/LASER3284/2024-Robot-Code/tree/kraken-swap","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - LASER3284/2024-Robot-Code at kraken-swap","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64125,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coach"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-inconsistencies/472997/1","custom_user_title":"Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3434595,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-14T16:04:28.375Z","cooked":"

In PathPlanner have you used the Telemetry to visualize if this is an issue with the robot not getting to the commanded setpoint or if the setpoint isn’t matching the real world expectations?

How are you testing this on Red vs Blue? Do you have a full field setup?

Is your camera updating odometry during auto?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-10-14T16:04:28.375Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":47.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":472997,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-inconsistencies","display_username":"Jason Daming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pathplanner.dev/gui-telemetry.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Telemetry | PathPlanner Docs","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18342,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-inconsistencies/472997/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3434597,"name":"Jim Jackson","username":"JJTJ2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-14T16:18:21.588Z","cooked":"

We have not messed with Telemtry and not really sure we know how to. We will look at this this afternoon.

We do not have a full field. We did notice that the notes are in the same location on blue as red just mirrored. So we set the robot up on the other side of the speaker and change the April tags on the speaker and amp. However last week we made the 90 minute drive to 4522 to use their full field and it was doing the exact same thing. Blue perfect, read all over the road.

The only way we can tell that the camera is updating odometry is through the shuffle board. It is moving location but it is showing that it is close to the right spot when we are at times 15" off in any direction.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-10-14T16:18:21.588Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":46.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":472997,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-inconsistencies","display_username":"Jim Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":18342,"username":"jdaming","name":"Jason Daming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64125,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coach"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-inconsistencies/472997/3","custom_user_title":"Coach","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3434605,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-14T16:35:22.759Z","cooked":"

If your camera is updating odometry I would disable that for this testing. I am not saying you need to disable it permanently for auto just 1 less variable to troubleshoot.

Telemetry tab (or doing a similar thing via your own collected data) is a vital piece of troubleshooting auto routines. It really helps us narrow down where to troubleshoot. Side note: I would really recommend this type of plotting actual vs commanded for every PID loop.

I am also curious if you make a super simple auto (say 1m forward if that has no problems then maybe 1m diagonally) does it also do strange things on the red side?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-10-14T16:35:22.759Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":472997,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-inconsistencies","display_username":"Jason Daming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64125,"username":"JJTJ2","name":"Jim Jackson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/51bf81/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18342,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-inconsistencies/472997/4","custom_user_title":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3434618,"name":"Jim Jackson","username":"JJTJ2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-14T17:03:27.910Z","cooked":"

We have put the lens cap on for autos and it is still doing weird things on red but runs fine on blue.

The simple auto that we tried was a 3 meter straight line that was also wonky/not straight/not repeatable. However, we do not remember if we tried this in red and blue or just one of the colors. When we have our autos that go to the center of the field for the notes, sometimes it makes it, sometimes it is short, sometimes it hits the wall on the side of the field, and sometimes it goes far enough but just misses the note. We will test this this afternoon to see if it is for both colors or just the red.

I haven’t looked at your code but what I meant by disable was comment out the addVisionMeasurement.

Are you visualizing the odometry? Does it follow the robots actual path or look like the expected?

We ran the 10 ft straight line test. Blue mostly straight and 9.75 ft, Red it was similar to blue mostly straight and 9.8 ft

jdaming:

What about the telemetry? That is really the key piece here

Totally agree. Pathplanner has a really convenient telemetry that takes just two seconds to open and connect, and will save you hours of time trying to figure the issue out blindly.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-10-15T02:25:04.814Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":16.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":472997,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-inconsistencies","display_username":"sam liu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64125,"username":"JJTJ2","name":"Jim Jackson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/51bf81/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60033,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CE Student @ UWaterloo | 5516 Alum "},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-inconsistencies/472997/9","custom_user_title":"CE Student @ UWaterloo | 5516 Alum ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3435112,"name":"Mahi Madhan Kumar","username":"Stormbreaker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/stormbreaker/{size}/268248_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-15T13:25:56.602Z","cooked":"

One thing that might help is using telemetry in Pathplanner to see exactly what’s going wrong on the red side. It’ll let you track the robot’s position, heading, and speed during the auto runs and compare it to what’s happening on the blue side. If the robot is drifting or over-rotating, telemetry can help show where the problem is—like whether it’s an issue with your sensors, drivetrain, or just how the paths are mirrored. It’s also a good idea to check your encoders and gyro data to make sure everything’s consistent between the red and blue paths. Sometimes just a slight tuning adjustment based on what you see in the telemetry can fix inconsistencies like these.

Aside from telemetry, you could also take a closer look at how the paths are being mirrored for the red side. Sometimes the way Pathplanner flips paths between red and blue alliances can cause small inconsistencies if something isn’t set up quite right in the code. Double-check that the mirroring logic in your C++ code is solid, and make sure there’s no weirdness happening when the robot transitions between field sides. It’s also worth considering whether field conditions, like worn-out carpet or uneven terrain, are affecting your paths differently on red vs. blue. Testing and fine-tuning your autonomous routines specifically for the red side might smooth things out, especially if there are small differences in how your robot handles direction changes or rotations when mirrored.

in the drive.cpp

HolonomicPathFollowerConfig(PIDConstants(4.6, 0.0, 0.2), PIDConstants(2, 0.0, 0.0), contants::MAXAUTO_SPEED, 16_in, ReplanningConfig(false, false))

So I am guessing the rotational gain is 2

Consider lowering the P and/or raising the D of the rotational gain. (Gains are in P, I, D format). It looks like you are getting overshoot on rotation.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-10-15T17:06:44.005Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":16.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":472997,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-inconsistencies","display_username":"Asher Olgeirson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64125,"username":"JJTJ2","name":"Jim Jackson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/51bf81/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51179,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-inconsistencies/472997/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3435339,"name":"Jim Jackson","username":"JJTJ2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-15T20:42:25.289Z","cooked":"

This has made things better. We lowered the P to 1.2 and raised the D to 1.0. I feel like it is more consistent but when we compare the the ending angle on the shuffle board (90 degrees) to the actual angle (approximately 125 degrees) we feel like we have dampened it too much and will try lowering the D to get the angle closer.

We also changed the wheel diameter. It was consistently going 2.8448 meters in a straight line no matter what we changed the P or D to. Now it is almost exactly 3.0 meters. Changing to P to 1.2 and D to 1.0 also took out the small rotation that we had in the straight line test.
